intro: Chomelia delascioi, commonly known as the Delascio's chomelia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
